text.p: United Microelectronics Corp has decided to slash its 1996 pre-tax profit forecast by 41.53 percent to T$8.08 billion from an earlier estimate of T$13.82 billion, a company statement said on Thursday.
The firm, Taiwan's second largest semiconductor maker, also cut its net profit forecast to T$8.21 billion from T$14.58 billion for the whole year, it said.
Its earnings-per-share forecast was adjusted to T$2.92 per share from the original projection of T$5.47.
The firm's 1996 sales revenue forecast was lowered to T$22.05 billion from T$31.89 billion.
The statement did not give reasons for the adjustments.
Several leading Taiwan semiconductor and computer firms, including computer giant Acer Inc, have already cut their forecasts for 1996 due to falling chip prices in international markets.
